description: fan with ivory blades; inlaid insects and plants on edges; off-white silk cord with inlaid bead and large silk tassel; one side decorated with scene at water's edge with figures and boats; opposite side decorated with 5 cranes near a stream with foliage
dimension: 15 1/2 x 28 3/4 x 1 1/2 in. (39.37 x 73.03 x 3.81 cm) (unfolded, without cord)
medium: Ink, color, and gold on silk, with ivory, gold lacquer, and mother-of-pearl inlay
text: This large, sumptuous fan, fashioned from ivory and decorated with painted silk, was probably produced for the export market. As domestic demand for ukiyo-e prints and paintings declined in the late nineteenth century, many traditional artists continued to make a living from their craft by supplying objects for the growing market abroad. Here, Kunihisa painted a riverside scene in pale tonalities showing fishermen with their poles and baskets, as well as a mother and child on an outing.
